intro: Labourdonnaisia richardiana, commonly known as the Richard's spurge, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with characteristic milky sap. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered yellow flowers. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
